column4: when I try to go to ubuntuforum.org I always redirected to my localhost page
anybody know how to troubleshoot my problem
Are your nameservers set properly?
In /etc/resolv.conf?
yes I have it correctly
What about /etc/hosts?
ok i check again
I'll cek already noting wrong with my configuration
when i try to login to yahoo mail I always get this page "The requested URL /ym/login was not found on this server."
when i try to login to yahoo mail I always get this page "The requested URL /ym/login was not found on this server." Apache/2.0.55 (Ubuntu) PHP/5.1.2 Server at us.f517.mail.yahoo.com Port 80
That DEFINITELY sounds like a problem with Yahoo, not your PC.
no, If I try on my xp machines it works fine
what is the output when you type in "ping us.f517.mail.yahoo.com"?
64 bytes from 61.6.222.233: icmp_seq=16 ttl=64 time=0.067 ms
Well see, from the looks of it, all outbound traffic is being redirected to localhost
then what should I do?
What is the output of "cat /etc/hosts"?  Usually when that happens you have a line in /etc/hosts that shouldn't be in there.
can I paste it in pastebin
go ahead
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19537
do you have any idea about it?
I'm stumped at the moment.  Your /etc/hosts looks fine to me...
yeah same to me... I dont know why it redirected to my localhost
